means: 预先警告，事先告知( forewarn的现在分词 )

PerfectNetExp.abs: So the study of marketing risk forewarning has become a necessary and practical issue ., 因此 , 探索营销风险预警管理 , 成为亟待解决的现实问题.

list.abs: the math ematical model of road traffic security risk forewarning ., 道路交通安全风险预警模糊评判模型.
establishing the administrative system of forewarning mechanism ;, 预警机制管理系统模型的构建;
气候预警模型,Climatic... ... ) Warning model 预警模型 ) forewarning model 预警模型 ) pre-warning model 预警模型.
警源指标,Alert source... ... ) warning index 预警指标 ) forewarning index 预警指标 ) early-warning index 预警指标.

entry.def: If you forewarn someone about something, you warn them in advance that it is going to happen.

example.ex: The Macmillan Guide had forewarned me of what to expect.
example.tran: 《麦克米伦指南》已经事先告诫过我会遇到什么情况。

means.word_mean: 1. an early warning about a future event

auth_sentence.content: Should I be grateful for the scientific advances that had given me forewarning?
auth_sentence.res_content: Should I be grateful for the scientific advances that had given me forewarning?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Should I be grateful for the scientific advances that had given me forewarning?

auth_sentence.content: The computer event analysis model appears to give forewarning of major events, based on deteriorating sentiment.
auth_sentence.res_content: The computer event analysis model appears to give forewarning of major events, based on deteriorating sentiment.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The computer event analysis model appears to give forewarning of major events, based on deteriorating sentiment.

auth_sentence.content: Mr Bryant angrily denied press reports that British authorities had any forewarning of the attack in a Dubai hotel.
auth_sentence.res_content: Mr Bryant angrily denied press reports that British authorities had any forewarning of the attack in a Dubai hotel.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mr Bryant angrily denied press reports that British authorities had any forewarning of the attack in a Dubai hotel.
